content: copilot cowl by dominique trad i love pretty sock yarn so i buy lots of lovelies and then of course don t knit socks with them so when a shawl is too much i knit copilot which is the sister pattern to autopilot equally simple this design features a garter stitch section separating the mesh for a little structure on a fingering weight 4ply cowl it may be adjusted in both length and width according to your taste the sample goes around the neck 3 times materials & tools 1 skein of 100g fingering weight 4ply yarn i used every single metre of my 100g araucania ranco sock which is 344m/376yd so i recommend at least 360m/400yd just in case 4mm/us6 & 5mm/us8 circular needles i used 80cm long 1 marker to show start of new row © dominique trad 2015 ravelry domknit copilot cowl gauge not important size sample is 16cm wide with a circumference of 180cm abbreviations k = knit p = purl yo = yarn over needle to create a stitch k2tog = knit 2 stitches together to decrease 1 instructions if you want to work to the yarn amount you have weigh your yarn before you begin using 5mm/us8 needles cast on 260sts or any multiple of 2 and join making sure not to twist place marker change to 4mm/us6 needles and knit garter edge as follows 26 round pattern 2st repeat 1 purl 2 knit 3 purl 4 knit 5 purl 6 knit weigh here for indication of how much to leave for other end and cast off 7 yo k2tog repeat to end 8 knit repeat the last 2 rounds 9 times 26 rounds worked from cast on weigh here for indication of how much yarn is required per 26 round repeat sample used 37g repeat the last 26 rounds twice more and then the first 6 row once more cast off loosely using larger needles or using a stretchy bind off method link on pattern page or any method that works for you blocking there is no need to block this cowl happy knitting © dominique trad 2015 ravelry domknit
